<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 235, 293]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/41  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 243, 318]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
October/November 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 216, 695]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 696, 732, 728]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A particle \(B\) of mass \(5\mathrm{kg}\) is at rest on a smooth horizontal table. A particle \(A\) of mass \(2.5\mathrm{kg}\) moves on the table with a speed of \(6\mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) and collides directly with \(B\). In the collision the two particles coalesce.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 136, 146, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 135, 623, 155]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of the combined particle after the collision.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 136, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 470, 186, 488]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 470, 673, 489]]<|/det|>
Find the loss of kinetic energy of the system due to the collision.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 472, 920, 491]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1400\mathrm{kg}\) is moving along a straight horizontal road against a resistance of magnitude \(350\mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
Find, in kW, the rate at which the engine of the car is working when it is travelling at a constant speed of \(20 \text{m s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 476, 186, 495]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 476, 907, 496]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the car when its speed is \(20 \text{m s}^{-1}\) and the engine is working at \(15 \text{kW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 494, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 82, 752, 217]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 234, 920, 270]]<|/det|>
Coplanar forces of magnitudes 8 N, 12 N, 10 N and \(P\) N act at a point in the directions shown in the diagram. The system is in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 281, 230, 299]]<|/det|>
Find \(P\) and \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 281, 920, 299]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line. It starts from rest at a point \(O\) on the line and at time \(t\) s after leaving \(O\) it has acceleration \(a \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 2}\), where \(a = 6t - 18\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 630, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the distance \(P\) moves before it comes to instantaneous rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 621, 92]]<|/det|>
When the \(0.8 \mathrm{kg}\) particle reaches the floor it comes to rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 643, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest height of the \(0.2 \mathrm{kg}\) particle above the floor.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
A car of mass \(1500\mathrm{kg}\) is pulling a trailer of mass \(750\mathrm{kg}\) up a straight hill of length \(800\mathrm{m}\) inclined at an angle of \(\sin^{- 1}0.08\) to the horizontal. The resistances to the motion of the car and trailer are \(400\mathrm{N}\) and \(200\mathrm{N}\) respectively. The car and trailer are connected by a light rigid tow-bar. The car and trailer have speed \(30\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) at the bottom of the hill and \(20\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\) at the top of the hill.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 153, 148, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 152, 910, 170]]<|/det|>
Use an energy method to find the constant driving force as the car and trailer travel up the hill.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
After reaching the top of the hill the system consisting of the car and trailer travels along a straight level road. The driving force of the car's engine is 2400 N and the resistances to motion are unchanged.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 137]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 682, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration of the system and the tension in the tow-bar.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 84, 700, 240]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 259, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
Three points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) lie on a line of greatest slope of a plane inclined at an angle of \(30^{\circ}\) to the horizontal, with \(AB = 1 \text{m}\) and \(BC = 1 \text{m}\), as shown in the diagram. A particle of mass \(0.2 \text{kg}\) is released from rest at \(A\) and slides down the plane. The part of the plane from \(A\) to \(B\) is smooth. The part of the plane from \(B\) to \(C\) is rough, with coefficient of friction \(\mu\) between the plane and the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 336, 146, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 336, 591, 356]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mu = \frac{1}{2}\sqrt{3}\), find the speed of the particle at \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 338, 920, 356]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]
